meanings.definition: To end the life of an animal or person in a painless way for reasons of mercy.
meanings.sent1: The kind vet had to euthanatize the old dog to end its suffering.
meanings.sent2: It is a difficult decision to euthanatize a beloved pet when they are in pain.
meanings.sent3: The compassionate act was to euthanatize the injured bird to prevent further suffering.
meanings.sent4: In the end, the only way to ease the horse's pain was to euthanatize it.
meanings.sent5: The humane choice was to euthanatize the sick cat to prevent any more pain.

meanings.definition: To perform euthanasia on an animal or person.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian had to euthanatize the terminally ill cat to end its suffering.
meanings.sent2: In some cases, it may be necessary to euthanatize an animal to prevent prolonged agony.
meanings.sent3: The decision to euthanatize the fish was made with a heavy heart.
meanings.sent4: The doctor had to euthanatize the patient to respect their wishes for a peaceful end.
meanings.sent5: It was a somber task to euthanatize the elderly dog, but it was done out of love and mercy.
